com.essbase.api.datasource
Interface IEssOlapApplication

All Superinterfaces:
IEssBaseObject, IEssExtendedObject, IEssProperties, IEssSubstitutionVariables
public interface IEssOlapApplication
extends IEssExtendedObject, IEssProperties, IEssSubstitutionVariables

The IEssOlapApplication is olap application.

Version:
1.0, 04/04/2001
Author:
Srini Ranga

setMaxAttachFileSize

public void setMaxAttachFileSize(int maxLroFileSize)
                          throws com.essbase.api.base.EssException
This is to set the maximum file size (in bytes) for Linked Reporting Objects (LRO) attachments. There is no default. There is no minimum or maximum value, excepting limitations imposed by your system resources.

The change will become effective after you invoke updatePropertyValues().

Parameters:
maxLroFileSize - The maximum attachment file size (in bytes). Pass 0 for unlimited file size.

com.essbase.api.base.EssException - if an error occur.

isLoadable

public boolean isLoadable()
                   throws com.essbase.api.base.EssException
Indicates whether the application can be loaded by users or not. If this is false, all users are prevented from loading (starting) the application. By default, application would be loadable.

Returns:
true if application is loadable.
Throws:
com.essbase.api.base.EssException - if an error occur.

setLoadable

public void setLoadable(boolean loadable)
                 throws com.essbase.api.base.EssException
Sets flag to indicate whether application can be loaded. If set to false, prevents all users from loading (starting) the application. Loadable is enabled by default. If set to true, allows users to load (start) the application. This only applies to users who have at least read privilege for the application.

The change will become effective after you invoke updatePropertyValues().

Parameters:
loadable - true if application is loadable.
Throws:
com.essbase.api.base.EssException - if an error occur.

                   throws com.essbase.api.base.EssException
Indicates whether the application would be loaded automatically when OLAP server is started.

Returns:
true if the application will be automatically loaded.
Throws:
com.essbase.api.base.EssException - if an error occur.

setAutoLoad

public void setAutoLoad(boolean autoLoad)
                 throws com.essbase.api.base.EssException
If you want the application to load automatically when OLAP Server starts, set this to true. By default, auto load is disabled.

The change will become effective after you invoke updatePropertyValues().

Parameters:
autoLoad - true if the application will be automatically loaded.
Throws:
com.essbase.api.base.EssException - if an error occur.

isAllowCommands

public boolean isAllowCommands()
                        throws com.essbase.api.base.EssException
Indicates whether users can issue commands to the application. If this is false, prevents all requests to databases in the application, including non-data-specific requests, such as viewing database information or changing database settings. All users would be affected, including other administrators. This setting remains in effect only for the duration of the session of owner who has disabled commands. Allowing commands would get enabled in either of the two ways: Session of the owner who disabled it expires or when the owner enables commands.

Returns:
true if the application is accepting user commands.
Throws:
com.essbase.api.base.EssException - if an error occur.

setAllowCommands

public void setAllowCommands(boolean allowCommands)
                      throws com.essbase.api.base.EssException
To enable or disable users from issuing commands to the application during the current session. If set to false, prevents all requests to databases in the application, including non-data-specific requests, such as viewing database information or changing database settings. All users are affected, including other administrators. Administrators are affected by this setting as a safety mechanism to prevent accidental updates to databases during maintenance operations. This setting remains in effect only for the duration of your session. The setting takes effect immediately, and affects users who are currently logged in, as well as users who log in later during your session. By default, commands are enabled.

Caution: If performing maintenance operations that require disabling commands, you must make those maintenance operations within the same session.

The change will become effective after you invoke updatePropertyValues().

Parameters:
allowCommands - flag to enable to disable any user from issuing a command, during current session.
Throws:
com.essbase.api.base.EssException - if an error occur.

isAllowConnects

public boolean isAllowConnects()
                        throws com.essbase.api.base.EssException
Indicates whether users who have permissions lower than Application Managers can cannot to this application or not.

Returns:
true if users can connect.
Throws:
com.essbase.api.base.EssException - if an error occur.

setAllowConnects

public void setAllowConnects(boolean allowConnects)
                      throws com.essbase.api.base.EssException
Sets flag to indicate whether users can connect to the application. If set to false, prevents any user with a permission lower than Application Managers from making connections to the databases that require the databases to be started. Database connections remain disabled for all databases in the application, until the application setting is re-enabled by setting this to true. By default, connections are enabled.

The change will become effective after you invoke updatePropertyValues().

Parameters:
allowConnects - if setfalse, disables users to connect.
Throws:
com.essbase.api.base.EssException - if an error occur.

isAllowUpdates

public boolean isAllowUpdates()
                       throws com.essbase.api.base.EssException
Indicates whether users with sufficient permissions can update data in the application. If this is false, the OLAP Server prevent all users (except Administrators) from making requests to databases in the application.

Returns:
true if the application is accepting user update commands.
Throws:
com.essbase.api.base.EssException - if an error occur.

setAllowUpdates

public void setAllowUpdates(boolean allowUpdates)
                     throws com.essbase.api.base.EssException
Sets flag to indicate whether users can update in the application. This is to enable or disable the Updates to this application till the current session is alive. If set to false, prevents all users (except Administrators) from making requests to databases in the application. Use before performing update and maintenance operations. The disable updates setting remains in effect only for the duration of your session.

Caution: If performing maintenance operations that require updates to be disabled, you must make those maintenance operations within the same session. This restriction does not include outline operations.

To block metadata updates, set the database to read-only mode, or disable commands and/or connects. By default, updates are enabled.

The change will become effective after you invoke updatePropertyValues().

Parameters:
allowUpdates - true if the application is accepting user update commands.
Throws:
com.essbase.api.base.EssException - if an error occur.

isEnableSecurity

public boolean isEnableSecurity()
                         throws com.essbase.api.base.EssException
Indicates whether application security is enabled. When security is disabled, OLAP server ignores all security settings in the application and treats all users as Application Managers. By default, security is enabled.

Returns:
true if security is enabled.
Throws:
com.essbase.api.base.EssException - if an error occur.

setEnableSecurity

public void setEnableSecurity(boolean enableSecurity)
                       throws com.essbase.api.base.EssException
Enables or disables the Security settings in the application. When security is disabled, OLAP server ignores all security settings in the application and treats all users as Application Managers. By default, security is enabled. The change will become effective after you invoke updatePropertyValues().

Parameters:
enableSecurity - if set to false security settings are disabled and vice versa.
Throws:
com.essbase.api.base.EssException - if an error occur.

getLockTimeout

public int getLockTimeout()
                   throws com.essbase.api.base.EssException
Gets the timeout period (in minutes) after which data-block locks are automatically removed. The default interval is 60 minutes.

Returns:
The timeout period (in minutes).
Throws:
com.essbase.api.base.EssException - if an error occur.

setLockTimeout

public void setLockTimeout(int lockTimeOutPeriod)
                    throws com.essbase.api.base.EssException
Sets the maximum time interval(in minutes) that locks on data blocks can be held by users. When a client data-block lock is held for more than the time out interval, OLAP server removes the lock and the transaction is rolled back. The default interval is 60 minutes. This setting affects all databases in the application. The change will become effective after you invoke updatePropertyValues().

Parameters:
lockTimeOutPeriod - the Lock time out period (in minutes).
Throws:
EssException.
com.essbase.api.base.EssException

getMinimumCubeAccess

public IEssCube.EEssCubeAccess getMinimumCubeAccess()
                                             throws com.essbase.api.base.EssException
Gets the minimum cube access (the lowest possible level of access for all users). This is the default access to cubes in this OLAP application.

Returns:
The minimum cube access.
Throws:
com.essbase.api.base.EssException - if an error occurs.

setMinimumCubeAccess

public void setMinimumCubeAccess(IEssCube.EEssCubeAccess minCubeAccess)
                          throws com.essbase.api.base.EssException
Sets the minimum cube access (the lowest possible level of access for all users). This is to grant all users a minimum level of permission to all databases in the application. Users with higher permissions than this specified minimum are not affected. The change will become effective after you invoke updatePropertyValues().

Parameters:
minCubeAccess - The minimum cube access.
Throws:
com.essbase.api.base.EssException - if an error occurs.

updatePropertyValues

public void updatePropertyValues()
                          throws com.essbase.api.base.EssException
Updates the property values. The changes made to this object via setXXX() methods will become effective only after you invoke updatePropertyValues().

Specified by:
updatePropertyValues in interface IEssProperties
Throws:
com.essbase.api.base.EssException - if an error occurs.

updatePropertyValues

public void updatePropertyValues(java.lang.String desc,
                                 int maxLroFileSize,
                                 boolean loadable,
                                 boolean autoLoad,
                                 boolean allowCommands,
                                 boolean allowConnects,
                                 boolean allowUpdates,
                                 boolean enableSecurity,
                                 int lockTimeOutPeriod,
                                 IEssCube.EEssCubeAccess minCubeAccess)
                          throws com.essbase.api.base.EssException
Updates the specified property values. If the update is successful, the local cache is set with these values.

Parameters:
desc - the description for this application.
maxLroFileSize - the maximum file size (in bytes) for Linked Reporting Objects (LRO) attachments. Pass 0 for unlimited file size. There is no default. There is no minimum or maximum value, excepting limitations imposed by your system resources.
loadable - if set to false, prevents all users from loading (starting) the application. Loadable is enabled by default. If set to true, allows users to load (start) the application. This only applies to users who have at least read privilege for the application.
autoLoad - can be set to true if you want the application to load automatically when Analytic Server starts. By default, auto load is disabled.
allowCommands - if set to false, prevents all requests to databases in the application, including non-data-specific requests, such as viewing database information or changing database settings. All users are affected, including other administrators. Administrators are affected by this setting as a safety mechanism to prevent accidental updates to databases during maintenance operations. This setting remains in effect only for the duration of your session. The setting takes effect immediately, and affects users who are currently logged in, as well as users who log in later during your session. [Caution: If performing maintenance operations that require disabling commands, you must make those maintenance operations within the same session]. By default, commands are enabled.
allowConnects - if set to false, prevents any user with a permission lower than Application Managers from making connections to the databases that require the databases to be started. Database connections remain disabled for all databases in the application, until the application setting is re-enabled by setting this to true. By default, connections are enabled.
allowUpdates - if set to false, prevents all users (except Administrators) from making requests to databases in the application. Use before performing update and maintenance operations. The disable updates setting remains in effect only for the duration of your session. [Caution: If performing maintenance operations that require updates to be disabled, you must make those maintenance operations within the same session]. This restriction does not include outline operations. To block metadata updates, set the database to read-only mode, or disable commands and/or connects. By default, updates are enabled.
enableSecurity - when security is disabled, OLAP server ignores all security settings in the application and treats all users as Application Managers. By default, security is enabled.
lockTimeOutPeriod - the time out period (in minutes). This is the the maximum time interval that locks on data blocks can be held by users. When a client data-block lock is held for more than the time out interval, OLAP server removes the lock and the transaction is rolled back. The default interval is 60 minutes. This setting affects all databases in the application.
minCubeAccess - the minimum cube access. This is to grant all users a minimum level of permission to all databases in the application. Users with higher permissions than this specified minimum are not affected.
Throws:
com.essbase.api.base.EssException

getCubes

public IEssIterator getCubes()
                      throws com.essbase.api.base.EssException
Gets the cubes in this application that are accessible to this user.

Returns:
The cubes (each of type IEssCube).
Throws:
com.essbase.api.base.EssException - if an error occurs.

createCube

public IEssCube createCube(java.lang.String cubeName,
                           IEssCube.EEssCubeType cubeType)
                    throws com.essbase.api.base.EssException
Creates a new cube within this application and starts it.

Parameters:
cubeName - The cube name.
cubeType - The cube type. Valid values for ASO applications - IEssCube.EEssCubeType.ASO and IEssCube.EEssCubeType.NORMAL, for BSO applications - IEssCube.EEssCubeType.NORMAL and IEssCube.EEssCubeType.CURRENCY
Returns:
The new cube.
Throws:
com.essbase.api.base.EssException - if an error occurs.

createCube

                           IEssCube.EEssCubeType cubeType,
                           boolean allowNonUniqNames)
                    throws com.essbase.api.base.EssException

Parameters:
cubeName - The cube name.
cubeType - The cube type. Valid values for ASO applications - IEssCube.EEssCubeType.ASO and IEssCube.EEssCubeType.NORMAL, for BSO applications - IEssCube.EEssCubeType.NORMAL and IEssCube.EEssCubeType.CURRENCY
allowNonUniqNames - if true, creates a database that supports non-unique member names.
Returns:
The new cube.

com.essbase.api.base.EssException - if an error occurs.

getCalcList

public IEssCalcList getCalcList(java.lang.String userName,
                                IEssCube Db)
                         throws com.essbase.api.base.EssException
Gets the list of calc scripts objects which are accessible to a user. If successful, the user's allow all calcs setting is returned in IEssCalcList.getAllCalcs() and a list of calc script object names is returned in IEssCalcList.getCalcList(). In order to access any calc script objects, the specified user must have at least calculate access to the appropriate database. If the IEssCalcList.getAllCalcs() flag is set to TRUE, IEssCalcList.getCalcList() is NULL. This function requires the caller to have database Design privilege (ESS_PRIV_DBDESIGN) for the specified database, unless they are getting their own calc list.

Parameters:
userName - - the username
Db - - IEssCube instance. If NULL, uses Application subdirectory, the userName requires ESS_PRIV_APPDESIGN privileges.
Returns:
- IEssCalcList
Throws:
com.essbase.api.base.EssException

getCalcListEx

public IEssCalcList getCalcListEx(java.lang.String userName,
                                  IEssCube Db)
                           throws com.essbase.api.base.EssException
Gets the list of calc scripts objects which are accessible to a user. EssCalcListEx will not return all calc access if the user has calc access because its part of a group. EssGetCalcList returns all calc enabled if calc access is thru group, even though if it is per user it does not return all calc TRUE just because it has calc access. This function requires the caller to have database Design privilege (ESS_PRIV_DBDESIGN) for the specified database, unless they are getting their own calc list.

Parameters:
userName - - the username
Db - - IEssCube instance. If NULL, uses Application subdirectory, the userName requires ESS_PRIV_APPDESIGN privileges.
Returns:
- IEssCalcList
Throws:
com.essbase.api.base.EssException

setCalcList

public void setCalcList(java.lang.String userName,
                        IEssCube Db,
                        boolean AllCalcs,
                        java.lang.String[] CalcList)
                 throws com.essbase.api.base.EssException
Sets the list of calc scripts objects which are accessible to a user. If the AllCalcs flag is set to TRUE, the Count and pCalcList arguments will be ignored. In order to access any calc script objects, the user must have at least calculate access to the appropriate database. This function requires the caller to have database Design privilege (ESS_PRIV_DBDESIGN) for the specified database.

Parameters:
userName - - the username
Db - - IEssCube instance. If NULL, uses Application subdirectory
AllCalcs - - Allow all calcs flag. If TRUE, the user can access all calc scripts, otherwise, they can only access those specified in the CalcList argument.
CalcList - - an array of calc script object names
Throws:
com.essbase.api.base.EssException

                      int options,
                      java.lang.String spec,

               throws com.essbase.api.base.EssException

comment - Description for this function.

getCDM_CDF

public java.lang.String[][] getCDM_CDF()
                                throws com.essbase.api.base.EssException
Gets custom defined functions and macros on the application.

The result will consist of 'n' x 5 elements where 'n' represents the total number of custom functions and custom macros. For any 'x' value ranging from 0 to n-1,
Result [x][0] represents the Name
Result [x][1] represents the Specification
Result [x][2] represents the Comment
Result [x][3] represents the Type either a value "cdf" or "cdm"
Result [x][4] represents the Scope which will be "local"

Returns:
list of CDF and CDMs.
Throws:
com.essbase.api.base.EssException - if an error occurs.
